p: The hypocholesterolemic activity of APNO can be related to the concentrations of MUFAs (30.74%) since a reduction in serum cholesterol levels is amongst the major beneficial effects of the intake of this class of fatty acids [ 32]. This effect was also observed in rats [ 28] and humans [ 11] fed diets rich in oleic (MUFA), linoleic, and Î±-linolenic (PUFAs) acids. The chemical constituents of the APNO are probably responsible for the hypocholesterolemic activity observed.
